alert.note: Alert for Alpine (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 30 at 10:57AM PST until January 01 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in California...Nevada... Truckee River Near Truckee affecting Placer and Nevada Counties. West Fork Carson River At Woodfords affecting Alpine and Douglas Counties. East Fork Carson River Below Markleeville affecting Alpine and Douglas Counties. Carson River Near Carson City affecting Carson City, Churchill, Douglas and Lyon independent cities. For the Truckee River...including Truckee, Farad, Reno, Vista, Wadsworth...elevated river levels are forecast. For the West Fork Carson River...including Woodfords...elevated river levels are forecast. For the East Fork Carson River...including Markleeville, Gardnerville...elevated river levels are forecast. For the Mainstem Carson River...including Carson City...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...West Fork Carson River At Woodfords. * WHEN...From this evening to Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Monitoring Stage. No flooding occurs. However, residents along the West Fork Carson River should be prepared for flooding if there are additional rises expected due to snowmelt and/or rainfall runoff. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:05 AM PST Friday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.5 feet late tomorrow morning. - Action stage is 12.5 feet. - Flood stage is 13.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by tomorrow morning.
